New Records: Nicholas Pooran's 53-ball 98 knock was the highest score in the T20 World Cup, but he fell short of his first T20 World Cup century by two runs
Obed McCoy's three for 14, including three wickets in eight balls, was a key factor in West Indies' win
Key Match Events: Nicholas Pooran's powerful 53-ball 98 knock set up West Indies' huge win over Afghanistan
Afghanistan's hope dwindled rapidly after slipping from 45 for one to 63 for five within the first 10 overs
Rashid Khan's decision to keep a deep backward point instead of a squarer third man allowed Johnson Charles to exploit that gap
Pre-Game Insights: Both teams were assured of a Super 8 berth, but West Indies displayed their batting might against Afghanistan
Post-Match Reflections: Nicholas Pooran's powerful innings ended dramatically: a direct hit from Azmatullah Omarzai caught Pooran short of his first T20 World Cup century by two runs
West Indies' 104-run victory against Afghanistan secured an unbeaten entry into the Super 8s
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played at the Daren Sammy National Cricket Stadium in Gros Islet, Saint Lucia
The result was a foregone conclusion by the end of the match
